conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab.
Block P slides on board ab, which is stationary on the ground.
Block P has a mass m and experiences a frictional force due to coefficient of kinetic friction μ2.
The frictional force f_P acting on P is given by f_P = μ2 * m * g.
Board ab has a mass M and experiences a frictional force due to the ground with coefficient of kinetic friction μ1.
Board ab experiences the frictional force f_P from block P in the opposite direction.
The board ab remains stationary, implying the net force on ab is zero.
The frictional force exerted by the ground f_ground must balance the frictional force from the block f_P.
Set up the equilibrium condition for the board ab: f_ground = f_P.
Substitute f_P into the equation: f_ground = μ2 * m * g.
The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is f_ground = μ2 * m * g.
